intro: Horkelia hispidula, commonly known as hairy horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Horkelia hispidula is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions.
